title: DPhil Candidate
description: Pursuing a DPhil in computational neuroscience at the Oxford Neural Interfacing Group. Building a pipeline coupling finite element modelling (COMSOL) with biophysical neuron modelling (NEURON/Python) to optimise electrode geometry for cortical stimulation and brain mapping. Developing surrogate models using artificial neural networks to predict neural activation, replacing computationally expensive physics simulations.

title: Research Intern
description: Contributed to research and development of regularisation methods for model adaptation during fine-tuning to mitigate spurious correlations. Evaluated models using accuracy, worst-group accuracy, and demographic parity metrics. Focused on fairness in AI and improving robustness on out-of-distribution tasks.

title: Engineering Intern
description: Architected platform infrastructure for data-centric AI, supporting responsible data collection for under-represented communities. Built data ingestion APIs and developed image recognition models using few-shot learning in PyTorch. Collaborated with social scientists to ensure data taxonomy reflected real-world nuance for long-tail concepts.

title: Software Engineer (Part-time)
description: Engineered computer vision pipeline using YOLO (PyTorch) and OpenCV to extract business intelligence from CCTV footage for agricultural compliance monitoring. Developed custom temporal algorithms for activity tracking. Deployed models to production on edge devices in June 2021, processing noisy real-world data in resource-constrained environments.

title: Cognitive Systems Neuroscience Internship
description: Built data processing pipeline in MATLAB for Granger causal analysis to decode neural communication pathways during attention and decision-making tasks. Analysed high-frequency electrocorticography (ECoG) data from macaques. Implemented parallel processing loops to reduce analysis time from days to hours.

title: Master of Physiotherapy (MPhysT)
description: Researched within the Biomedical Engineering Research Group. Thesis: 'Determining the Nature of Free Will Using Machine Learning'. Trained convolutional neural networks (CNNs) on electrocorticographic (ECoG) data using Python, TensorFlow, MATLAB, and EEGLab to classify decision-making states.

title: Bachelor of Physiotherapy (BPhysT)
description: Graduated Cum Laude with 78% average. Conducted a randomised control trial (RCT) investigating the effect of positive expiratory pressure on airway hyper-reactivity at Steve Biko Academic Hospital. Gained foundation in anatomy, physiology, neurology, and biomechanics that informs current computational neuroscience work.

title: Community Service Physiotherapist
description: Worked in resource-constrained government hospital managing caseloads in adult and neonatal intensive care units (ICU), burns units, and neurology wards. Applied diagnostic logic to complex biological systems under extreme time pressure in multidisciplinary teams.
